result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury trial on October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dimontray M Barker in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Dimontray M Barker in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates a crucial witness is in warrant status and it is imperative that this witness testify for the defense. Mr. Conner asks for one more trial date. Defendant's existing sentence is done in May. The State was prepared to proceed but understands.

BTC: This will be the last time the matter is to be set for trial with or without Mr. Ward's appearance.  Jury trial scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

For the Defendant to come from Racine Correctional Institution to court on 1-5-2016 at 1:30 PM.

Attorney Donald L. Conner in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Deft is still in the prison system. The State neglected to do an OTT. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. No discovery issues. Parties MIL are reviewed and granted. The State does not have test results back but she anticipates results to be back by the time of trial. The State expects the trial to be less than a day. There will be 1 alternate, 5 strikes each. The Court will give the following preliminary instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101.

BTC: JT remains
defense
defense

Defendant Dimontray M Barker in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Dimontray M Barker in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that there are two statements in question. The defense is not going to dispute the first statement. The second statement was more of an excited utterance so Mr. Conner does not believe the hearing is necessary. The Court conducts a colloquy with Mr. Barker. The State does ot object. 

BTC: The Court is satisfied that under the advice of counsel, the defendant freely, knowlingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to a Miranda/Goodchild hearing. The State may use the statements of the defendant in their case in chief.

Donald Conner
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dimontray M Barker in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Dimontray M Barker in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter Mark Garvin.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
